    　　 　 卷四百八十一
    　　 　　 痘科类编释意　清．翟良
    　　 　　　 原痘论
    　　 　　　 论气血并晰气血盈亏消长之理　　 　　　 部位论
    　　 　　　 头面预肿渐肿论
    　　 　　　 痘成功有次序色有递变不同论　　 　　　 形色论
    　　 　　　 宁教有色而无形休教有形而无色论　　 　　　 虚实寒热不同辨
    　　 　　　 评诸家明用药寒热要各得其宜　　 　　　 汗下论
    　　 　　　 热不可尽除说
    　　 　　　 解毒化毒论
    　　 　　　 痘不为害惟毒为害论
    　　　　　 痘有成色当就其成色而成就之治法不可执一论　　 　　　 气尊血分者生毒参阳位者死解　　 　　　 痘不以稀密分轻重说
    　　 　　　 痘中疹子与正疹子丹毒斑点沙子不同论　　 　　　 痘不可与凡疮同治论
    　　 　　　 痘疹不同论
    　　 　　　 变黑归肾肾经留邪论
    　　 　　　 首尾忌脑麝论[417p]

    Volume 481
    Classification of Smallpox and Its Commentary, by Zhai Liang, Qing Dynasty
    Original Discussions on Smallpox
    Discussion on the relationship between Qi and Blood, including the principles of their flourishing and declining
    Discourse on Locations
    Discussion on gradual swelling of the head and face
    Discussion on the order of appearance and the different colorations of smallpox
    Discussion on the forms and colors
    It is better to have color without form than to have form without color
    Distinction between excess and deficiency, cold and heat
    Evaluation of various schools on the appropriate use of herbs, balancing cold and heat
    Discussion on sweating and purging
    The assertion that heat should not be completely eliminated
    Discussion on detoxification and dissolving poison
    Discussion on how smallpox itself is not harmful, but poison is harmful
    Smallpox treatments should align with its characteristics; one should not adhere to a single method
    The superiority of Qi and the notion that the Blood's division leads to the creation of poison, while the Yang aspect leads to death
    Smallpox should not be classified as light or heavy based on its density
    Discussion on the differences between rashes within smallpox and typical rashes or dan poison spots
    Smallpox should not be treated in the same manner as ordinary sores
    Discussion on the differences between smallpox and other rashes
    The phenomenon of turning black is attributed to the kidneys, with evil residing in the kidney channels
    A caution against using musk in relation to the head and tail[417p]

    　　 　　　 申明骨节烦疼腰如被杖
    　　 　　　 申明筋抽脉惕
    　　 　　　 申明遍体炎炎

    　　 　　　 申明飞浆
    　　 　　　 申明泡涌[422p]

    Expressing tranquility and restlessness, with a sorrowful face that can be touched.
    The joints are troubled and painful, the waist feels beaten.
    The muscles are tense and the veins alert.
    The body is overwhelmingly hot.
    The limbs are singularly cold.
    Sweat pours from the whole body.
    Sweat on the head is like steam.
    Poison surges, causing swelling.
    There are lumps and bumps.
    There are pre-sealed and pre-swollen areas.
    Red threads encircle the eyes, with hair standing on end.
    Pimples appear like dirt, with foul breath that repels others.
    The hair begins to clench the teeth.
    The hair starts to twist the tongue.
    Both cheeks are flushed red, without a single pimple.
    Emerging like needles.
    Darkness sinks awkwardly.
    Purple spots float like duckweed.
    There are flea-like marks.
    Clusters of unusual pimples resembling beads.
    Awful colors and the corresponding treatment.
    Four types of poison emerge.
    The pimples are good evidence of malice.
    White pimples are bold indicators.
    Impending flow.
    Bubbles surge.[422p]

   Arts and Literature
     Volume Five Hundred Eighteen
          "Biography of Bian Que and Cang Gong" by Sima Qian, Han Dynasty
          Preface to the Arts and Literature Section of the Book of Han by Ban Gu, Han Dynasty[468p]

    　　　　 劝医论　梁·简文帝
    　　 　　 言医　唐·李华
    　　 　　 迷医　宋·龚鼎臣
    　　 　　 医铭　宋·吕诲
    　　 　　 翰林医官尚药奉御王永可依前尚药奉御直翰林医官　宋·李清臣　　 　　 盖公堂记　宋·苏轼
    　　 　　 药诵　宋·苏轼
    　　 　　 送夏医序　宋·朱熹
    　　 　　 与杨元甫论梁宽甫病证书　元·许衡　　 　　 读药书漫记　元·刘因
    　　 　　 丹溪翁传赞　元·戴良
    　　 　　 赠贾思诚序　明·宋濂

    　　　 卷五百十九
    　　　　 旋风吟　宋·邵雍[469p]

    Admonitions on Medicine - Liang, Emperor Jianwen
    On Medicine - Tang, Li Hua
    Bewildered by Medicine - Song, Gong Dingchen
    Inscription on Medicine - Song, Lü Huai
    Physician at the Hanlin Academy, Chief of Medicine Wang Yongke - Following the previous Chief of Medicine at the Hanlin Academy - Song, Li Qingchen
    Record of the Pavilion of the Great Duke - Song, Su Shi
    Ode to Medicine - Song, Su Shi
    Preface to Sending off the Summer Physician - Song, Zhu Xi
    Correspondence on the Illness of Liang Kuangfu with Yang Yuanfu - Yuan, Xu Heng
    Casual Notes on Reading Medical Books - Yuan, Liu Yin
    Tribute to Master Danxi - Yuan, Dai Liang
    Preface to Bestowing on Jia Sicheng - Ming, Song Lian

    Volume Five Hundred Nineteen
    Ode to the Whirlwind - Song, Shao Yong [469p]

    　　　　 臂痛吟　宋·邵雍
    　　　　 有病吟　宋·邵雍
    　　　　 又　宋·邵雍
    　　　　 伤杜婴　宋·王安石
    　　　　 其二　宋·王安石
    　　　　 赠医者邓献匡　宋·杨时
    　　　　 和朱松坡　宋·文天祥
    　　　　 赠蜀医锺正甫　宋·文天祥　　　　 彭通伯卫和堂　宋·文天祥　　　　 赠撄宁生　明·宋禧
    　　　　 赠杨医官　明·陈琛
    　　　　 赠殷矩　明·赵鹤
    　　　　 题萱寿太医邢生母　明·王世贞　　　　 将赴青州道别医友王昌年　明·王世贞　　　　 即事呈邢邵二医　明·王世贞　　　　 其二　明·王世贞
    　　　　 济川篇为太医邢先生题　明·王世贞　　　　 赠义兴宣疡医　明·张羽
    　　　　 送名医凌汉章还苕三首　明·秦康王
    　　 纪事　杂录　外编
    　　　 卷五百二十
    　　　　 纪事
    　　　　 杂录
    　　　　 外编
    [470p]
